title: The Peaceable Kingdom
provenance_text:
Edward Hicks [1780-1840]. US Congressman Henry W. Watson [1856-1933], Langhorne PA. Dr. Arthur Edwin Bye [1885-1969], Holicong, PA, by c. 1940 until December 1940 [1]; Charles J. Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA (Lugt Suppl. 633b), December 1940 until April 1, 1973 [2]; his bequest to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1974.

Notes:
[1]. See "American Paintings and Sculpture to 1945 in the Carnegie Museum of Art," pages 254-255. See also copies of correspondence between John O'Connor, Jr. and Dr. Bye (Carnegie Institute Archives, AAA) in curatorial file.
[2]. Mr. Rosenbloom purchased the painting for $500 on November 2, 1940 and paid for it the following month (check dated December 2, 1940.)
